inclusion.criterion: standard for diagnosis of extraesophageal reflux
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: performed in accordance with manufacturer guidelines
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: mild, self-limited epistaxis has been rarely reported
inclusion.label: unknown

inclusion.criterion: topical Afrin may be used to control any mild epistaxis
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: topical 4% lidocaine will be applied to minimize dysphagia
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: patient may have a diminished risk of recurrence of nasal polyposis
inclusion.label: unknown

inclusion.criterion: undiagnosed reflux disease will allow it to be treated appropriately
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: patient will be given their PPI medication free of charge for the duration of the study
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: noninvasive pH probe study will be done free of charge
inclusion.label: met

exclusion.criterion: history of surgical treatment for reflux disease
exclusion.label: unknown

exclusion.criterion: history of allergic or adverse reaction to Prevacid
exclusion.label: unknown

notes: The patient has abdominal pain and vomiting, but no history of allergies or using any medications. He drinks around 60 units of alcohol per week and smokes 22 cigarettes per day.
